event.description: {CovLStrv2{{t{The property {0} is a source of untrusted data.}{{code{l.search}}}}}}

{CovLStrv2{{t{Passing {0} to {1}.}{{code{l.protocol + "//" + l.hostname + (l.port ? ":" + l.port : "") + l.pathname.split("/").slice(0, 1 + pathSegmentsToKeep).join("/") + "/?/" + l.pathname.slice(1).split("/").slice(pathSegmentsToKeep).join("/").replace(/&/g, "~and~") + (l.search ? "&" + l.search.slice(1).replace(/&/g, "~and~") : "") + l.hash}}}{{code{l.replace}}}}}}

{CovLStrv2{{t{Calling {0} with the tainted value in {1}.}{{code{l.replace}}}{{code{l.protocol + "//" + l.hostname + (l.port ? ":" + l.port : "") + l.pathname.split("/").slice(0, 1 + pathSegmentsToKeep).join("/") + "/?/" + l.pathname.slice(1).split("/").slice(pathSegmentsToKeep).join("/").replace(/&/g, "~and~") + (l.search ? "&" + l.search.slice(1).replace(/&/g, "~and~") : "") + l.hash}}}}{t{ This allows a cross-site scripting attack: an attacker can execute arbitrary JavaScript code in another user's web browser.}}}}

{CovLStrv2{{t{The untrusted data reaches a sink that can either lead to HTML injection, JavaScript code execution, or the manipulation of a URL starting with the "javascript:" or "data:" schemes. Any of these can lead to a DOM XSS vulnerability.{ul{HTML injection: Either escape properly the untrusted data or use a safe API to insert this data to the DOM; direct HTML manipulation as text should be avoided.}{JavaScript code execution: Validate any untrusted data against a whitelist so it's not possible for an attacker to have its supplied code executing.}{URL manipulation: Make sure the scheme is whitelisted and doesn't allow for the injection of a URL like: "data:text/html;,<img/src/onerror=alert(1)>".}}}}}}

eventSetCaptions.eventSetCaption: Flow of tainted data to a vulnerable sink

{CovLStrv2{{t{The untrusted data reaches a sink that can either lead to HTML injection, JavaScript code execution, or the manipulation of a URL starting with the "javascript:" or "data:" schemes. Any of these can lead to a DOM XSS vulnerability.{ul{HTML injection: Either escape properly the untrusted data or use a safe API to insert this data to the DOM; direct HTML manipulation as text should be avoided.}{JavaScript code execution: Validate any untrusted data against a whitelist so it's not possible for an attacker to have its supplied code executing.}{URL manipulation: Make sure the scheme is whitelisted and doesn't allow for the injection of a URL like: "data:text/html;,<img/src/onerror=alert(1)>".}}}}}}
